paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the Na+ permeation and block of hERG potassium channels, focusing on the inactivation gating and its implications. Several mutations in the KCNH2 gene are mentioned, but no clinical or penetrance data related to human subjects are provided.

functional_data.summary: The S631A mutation was used to remove hERG inactivation gating.

variants.evidence_level: Functional evidence from in vitro studies
key_quotes: Removal of fast inactivation by the S631A mutation abolished the Na+ current.

functional_data.summary: The T623A mutation was used to accelerate hERG inactivation.

variants.evidence_level: Functional evidence from in vitro studies
key_quotes: Acceleration of fast inactivation by mutations T623A, F627Y, and S641A did not affect the hERG Na+ current, but greatly diminished the hERG K+ current.

functional_data.summary: The F627Y mutation was used to accelerate hERG inactivation.

variants.evidence_level: Functional evidence from in vitro studies
key_quotes: Acceleration of fast inactivation by mutations T623A, F627Y, and S641A did not affect the hERG Na+ current, but greatly diminished the hERG K+ current.

functional_data.summary: The S641A mutation was used to accelerate hERG inactivation.

variants.evidence_level: Functional evidence from in vitro studies
key_quotes: Acceleration of fast inactivation by mutations T623A, F627Y, and S641A did not affect the hERG Na+ current, but greatly diminished the hERG K+ current.

functional_data.summary: The S624A mutation was used to assess the interaction between external Na+ and hERG channels.

variants.evidence_level: Functional evidence from in vitro studies
key_quotes: Mutations in the channel pore and S6 regions, such as S624A, F627Y, and S641A, abolished the inhibitory effects of external Na+ on the hERG Na+ current.

challenges: No clinical or penetrance data available for human subjects.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper focuses on functional studies of KCNH2 variants in vitro, with no human subject data provided.
